abstract: Despite protests inside and outside Bank of America’s annual meeting, shareholders signed off on the $7 million 2011 pay package for the chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
snippet: Despite protests inside and outside Bank of America’s annual meeting, shareholders signed off on the $7 million 2011 pay package for the chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTE, N.C. — Despite noisy protests inside and outside Bank of America’s annual meeting here Wednesday, shareholders signed off on the $7 million 2011 pay package for the chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.

headline.main: Bank of America Investors Complain, but Approve Chief’s Pay
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Investors Complain, but Approve Chief’s Pay

abstract: Cost-cutting measures aided profitability, but the company warned that it faced “a cautious” environment for corporate spending on information technology.
snippet: Cost-cutting measures aided profitability, but the company warned that it faced “a cautious” environment for corporate spending on information technology.
lead_paragraph: John T. Chambers, chief executive of Cisco Systems, on Wednesday gave a dark outlook for the world economy. It looks like investors in the company, which makes network equipment, agreed and started selling Cisco shares.

headline.main: Cisco Income Rises in Line With Forecasts
headline.print_headline: Cisco Cautious Despite 22% Rise in Income
